intro: Osteospermum teretifolium, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy, daisy-like blooms with yellow centers and pink or white petals. Its leaves are typically gray-green and hairy, providing a distinctive appearance. Osteospermum teretifolium is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant flowers and drought tolerance.
